column4: anyone happen to know of any open source IT automation tools that one could use to monitor the status of many computers on the network, remote-control both windows and *nix machines, push out updates/patches to many machines at once, stuff like that?
boss wants to avoid paying 3k+ for closed source software that does this

- you can probably do all of it using OSS and some scripting for the automation, but it's been a while since I have had to look at the windows side of it...  if you were in the UK, I'd give you my office number, that is the kind of thing we could sort out for you for a lot less than 3k...
